column2: ABSTRACT
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent font-largest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: This paper proposes a practical approach employing n-gram
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: models and error-correction rules for Thai key prediction and
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Thai-English language identification. The paper also proposes
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: rule-reduction algorithm applying mutual information to reduce
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the error-correction rules. Our algorithm reported more than
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 99% accuracy in both language identification and key
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: prediction.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1 INTRODUCTION
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: For Thai users, there are always two annoyances while typing
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: Thai-English bilingual documents, which are usual for Thais.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: The first is when the users want to switch from typing Thai to
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: English, they have to input a special key to tell the operating
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: system to change the language mode. Further, if the language-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: switching key is ignored, they have to delete the token just typed
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and re-type that token after language switching. The second is
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that Thai has more than 100 alphabets, to input about half of all
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Thai characters, the user has to use combinations of two keys
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: (shift key + another key) to input them. Some of the other Asian
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: users also have the same problem.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: It will be wonderful, if there is a intelligent keyboard
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: system that is able to perform these two tasks –switching
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: language and shifting key– automatically. This paper proposes a
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: practical solution for these disturbances by applying trigram
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: character probabilistic model and error-correction rules. To
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: optimize number of the generated error-correction rules, we
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: propose a rule reduction approach using mutual information.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: More than 99 percent of key prediction accuracy results are
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: reported.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 RELATED WORKS
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: There is only one related work on inputting Chinese words
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: through 0-9 numpad keys. [8] applied lexical trees and Chinese
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: word n-grams to word prediction for inputting Chinese
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sentences by using digit keys. They reported 94.4% prediction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: accuracy. However, they did not deal with automatic language
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: identification process. The lexical trees they employed required
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a large amount of space. Their algorithm is required some
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: improvement for a practical use.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: 3 THE APPROACH
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent font-largest column-top numbered-heading1 above-line-space

column2: 3.1 Overview
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-space numbered-heading2

column2: In the traditional Thai keyboard input system, a key button with
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: the help of language-switching key and the shift key can output
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 4 different characters. For example, in the Thai keyboard the ‘a’-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line numbered-heading1 tailchar-hiphen

column2: key button can represent 4 different characters in different
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: modes as shown in Table 1.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 1: A key button can represent different characters in
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: __Table 1__
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column centered left-indent right-indent box aligned-line table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: However, using NLP technique, the Thai-English
column3: page=0 xpos=6 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: keyboard system which can predict the key users intend to type
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: without the language-selection key and the shift key, should be
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: efficiently implemented. We propose an intelligent keyboard
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system to solve this problem and have implemented with
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: successful result.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: To solve this problem, there are basically two steps:
column3: page=0 xpos=6 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-colon

column2: language identification and Thai key prediction. Figure 1 shows
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: how the system works.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=0 xpos=6 ypos=5 right-column left-indent right-indent box indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space figure-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.2 Language Identification
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2

column2: The following example illustrates the disturbance of language
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: switching. In the Thai input mode, typing a word “language”
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: will result “ ­¢gÁ¢Á ”. It is certain that the user has to delete
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: sequence “ ­¢gÁ¢Á ” and then switches to the English mode before
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line line-space headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: retyping the key sequence to get the correct result of “language”.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line line-space headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: Therefore an intelligent system to perform language switching
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-capital

column2: automatically is helpful in eliminating the annoyance.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In general, different languages are not typed
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: connectedly without spaces between them. The language-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: identification process starts when a non-space character is typed
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: after a space. Many works in language identification, [3] and [5],
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: have claimed that the n-gram model gives a high accuracy on
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language identification. After trying both trigrams and bigrams,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: we found that bigrams were superior. We then compare the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: following bigram probability of each language.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=1 ypos=2 left-column left-indent right-indent box headchar-capital

column2: considered in Thai texts.

column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: 3.3.2 Error Correction for Thai Key Prediction
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading3

column2: In some cases of Thai character sequence, the trigram model
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: fails to predict the correct key. To correct these errors, the error-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: correction rules proposed by [1] and [2] is employed.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: considered to prepare the error correction rule. The left and right
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: “glik[lkl9in” is predicted as “ Á«¦¬­µ­¦r ”, where the correct
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line above-line-space

column2: prediction is “ Á«¦¬«µ­¦r ”. The string “ik[lkl9” is then collected as
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line line-space headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: an error sequence and “ ¬«µ­ ” is collected as the correct pattern
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line line-space headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: to amend the error.

column2: 3.3.2.2 Rule Reduction
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space

column2: In the process of collecting the patterns, there are a lot of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: redundant patterns collected. For example, patterns no.1-3 in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Table 2 should be reduced to pattern 4. To reduce the number of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line string-table headchar-capital

column2: rules, left mutual information and right mutual information ([7])
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: are employed. When all patterns are shortened, the duplicate
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: patterns are then eliminated in the final.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5 CONCLUSION
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent font-largest shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: In this paper, we have applied trigram model and error-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: correction rules for intelligent Thai key prediction and English-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: Thai language identification. The result of the experiment shows
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: the high accuracy of more than 99 percent accuracy, which is
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: very impressive. Through this system typing is much more
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: easier and enjoyable for Thais. This technique is expected to be
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: able to apply to other Asian languages. Our future work is to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: apply the algorithm to mobile phones, handheld devices and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: multilingual input systems.
